New Records: Stephen Curry made all 8 3-point attempts in the Warriors' 139-105 win over the 76ers
Key Match Events: Curry had 13 points in the third, including back-to-back deep 3s, and raised both arms to his head in mock disbelief
Pre-Game Insights: Warriors got a needed wire-to-wire win against a 76ers team with all three of its stars healthy
Post-Match Reflections: 76ers gave up a season high in points, allowing Curry to get going and conceding a number of open looks from beyond the arc
Miscellaneous Highlights: Warriors shot 56% (22 of 39) from 3-point range and 61% from the field overall
Curry played through a right thumb sprain with tape on his right hand
Others: Joel Embiid led the Sixers with 28 points and 14 rebounds
Jonathan Kuminga added 20 points off the bench
